attributes.action: create sufficient NHS training posts to ensure that young doctors have a future career prospects within the NHS
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The lack of training posts for 30,000 educated and part-trained doctors who are now forced to compete for 22,000 positions is a disgrace both to the National Health Service and its paymasters. Creating such posts is an urgent priority.

At least £2bn has been invested in 8,000 young doctors who now, because of a drastic shortage of training posts and what seems yet another failed planning process, are facing the prospect of having to leave the NHS altogether after at least eight years of work qualifying; not to mention years of accumulated student debt. 

These junior doctors represent the best young minds of their generation. It is heartbreaking to see such bright young people being forced to consider leaving their career and country. These young doctors need to have sufficient training posts and future career prospects created within the NHS.
